FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

  For further information contact : Todd Mahan, Saftey & Regulations manager
  
  l. The facility policy
     A. The owners,Managment,and Employees of Nichols Agriservice LLC., Nichols Iowa are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of Anhydrous Ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, The facility is prepared to work with the local Fire Department,LEPC, or other authorities, to migrate any release and to minimze the impact of the release on people and the enviroment. Our company policy would be to shut off any emegency valves that is possible for us to get to. Evacute any persons in harmes way.

  ll. Facility Information
     A. The primary activity at the facility is the storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia for sale to farmers.

     B. Anhydrous Ammonia is received, and distributed for application on crops as fertilizer nutrients.

 111. The accidental release, prevention program.

      A. The facility has implemented the provisions of the saftey requirements for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia, K-61, published by the American National Standards Institute Inc.

      B. The facility has implemented the standards of the U.S. Occupational Saftey and Health Administration , 29CFR 1910.111, storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.Due to the fact that we are inspected annually by IDALS,we do manual and visual inspections periodically to maintain an accident free facility.

 1v. The five year accident history.

      A. There has been no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia that has caused any death, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, nor have resulted in any off site deaths, injury, evacuations, sheltering, property damage, or inviromental damage.

 v. The emergency response program.

      A. The facility has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.The Emergency Action Plan at this facility tells employes what to do in an emergecy situ

ation such as to close all emegency shutoff valves,to remove any injured employee from the scene. Call the local fire department and assit with evacuation of plant and residents.

      B. The facility has provided to the state and local authorites, the emergency action plan and community right to know information as required under SARA title III (EPCRA).

  VI. Planned changes to improve safety.

      A. Saftey improvement is an ongoing process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are preformed to access the maintenance of safe conditions and evaluate employee training. There are no specific anhydrous ammonia saftey recommendations at this point in time.
